BCA Sekuritas
Consumer Sector
Back to basic

The perpetual need for life’s necessities
While 1H17 FMCG volume was soft, we are of the view that it is unlikely staple goods demand will be further dimmed, given the necessity for such items. We are thus optimistic about a 2018F volume rebound, given 2017F soft volume (which sets a low base), coupled with the thought that this cutback in spending for basic items is unlikely to continue over the long term. Lebaran in 2017F also marked thefirst year in recent times when Lebaran festivities were all recorded in 1H17, which results in initial YoY growth contraction on shorter working days, but as 2018F Lebaran will also be recorded fully in 1H18, we believe that YoY growth will be on a more equitable footing. Going into 2018F, we continue to surmise that food items will outperform non-food ones, and that the trend will aim for the low ASP mass market segment. While food in general may perform better, we are of the view that Personal Care willalso be in the spotlight in 2018F, as consumers grow more focused on selected personal care products.

Most commodity prices are in favor of staple goods
We expect a majority of raw materials (commodities related to each raw material) to enjoy favorable prices in 2018F: CPO prices should head south on a supply glut, to MYR2,650/ton in 2018F from MYR2,728/ton in 2017F. Post-low prices in 2017F, wheat price is expected to rise slightly, to USD4.8-5.1/bushel, but we do not think that the increasewill be enough to pull down earnings significantly. Skimmed milk powder (SMP) is also expected to ride the southbound train, as European SMP production looks unabated, coupled with friendlier regulations to export SMP from Canada. Even if there is an increase in SMP prices, we do not think that they will reach USD20/cwt (current: USD15.6/cwt). That said, we are expecting another year of good margins for our staples names, especially for (use both CPO and SMP), ICBP (CPO and SMP) & (SMP).

Sector to Overweight, and as top picks
We are switching gears and putting our Staples sector with an Overweight call, as demand should pick up, accommodating raw material prices, relatively stable USD / IDR rate and soft inflation to foster purchasing power. We are of the view that the gradual improvement in purchasing power will prove to be beneficial for small ticket items first, before affecting big-ticket items. We continue to like the big names with deep-rooted presence in Indonesia, such as ICBP (TP: IDR10,500) and (TP: IDR57,500). Valuation is never cheap for them, but their share prices, product portfolios and operational skills have proven that they do deserve the premium. Risks include: softer-than-expected purchasing power, higher commodity prices, regulations that hinder purchasing power progress, volatile exchange rate.

By MNC Sekuritas
Should We Worry about The Sentiment?
We visited WSBP and met directly with WSBP management, who assured us that the sentiments do not affect payments to WSBP. This is based on the fact that the funds used for the payment of each project to WSBP are already prepared by WSKT before the project is completed. Most of the projects undertaken by WSBP are turnkey (payments will be paid when the project is done), which carries a larger profit margin. We see that the information currently circulating is a short-term negative sentiment. This is based on a statement from management that WSBP's financial condition is still healthy and growing, and is not affected by the issue circulating about the parent company and not yet clear about the restriction of material use. Since we have not received any clarification from the Government, we believe that the fundamental condition of WSBP remains solid, supported by: 1) Low Debt-to-Equity Ratio (DER) at a level of 0.53x (as of 1H17), thus indicating more space for increased WSBP leverage in the future; 2) EPS of WSBP shows a strengthening trend of CAGR of +26.55% not proportional to current stock price weakness; 3) Price to Earnings (P/E), current P/E ratio is at 10.99x lower than competitor; 4) WSBP is still optimistic with revenue reaching Rp7.75 trillion or growing by 64.30% in FY17E, net profit targeted amounted to Rp1.13 trillion, for an increase of 78% from the realization of net income in FY16.

UPGRADE to BUY TP 4300
Limited Downside, Turning Positive
We upgrade HMSP’s rating from Neutral to Buy. We believe the market has priced in most of the negatives while we started seeing potential volume catalysts that should re-rate the stock. Global and Commodity News

OIL
Permintaan Minyak 2017 Tertinggi dalam 2 Tahun Terakhir
, JAKARTA—Laporan International Energy Agency (IEA) menyebutkan permintaan minyak global pada tahun ini akan mencapai level tertinggi sejak 2015 karena meningkatnya konsumsi di Eropa dan Amerika Serikat.
IEA pada Rabu (13/9/2017) memaparkan sebagaian besar negara perekonomian utama global akan menyerap lebih banyak minyak. Pada 2017, konsumsi akan naik 1,6 juta barel per hari (bph) dari tahun sebelumnya menjadi 97,7 juta bph.
Laporan terbaru memberikan optimisme terhadap pelaku pasar, karena volume permintaan naik 100.000 bph dari estimasi sebelumnya sebesar 97,6 juta bph. Karena itu, rilis IEA pada pukul 9.00 waktu London atau 16.00 WIB, langsung memanaskan harga minyak sekitar 1%.
Bahkan saat penutupan perdagangan Rabu (13/9/2017), harga WTI kontrak Oktober menguat 2,2% menuju US$49,30 per barel, atau level tertinggi dalam 5 pekan terakhir. Namun, kini pada Kamis (14/9/2017) pukul 9.50 WIB harga WTI terkoreksi 0,14% menuju US$49,23 pper barel.
“Permintaan pertumbuhan terus menjadi lebih kuat dari perkiraan sebelumnya, terutama di Eropa dan AS,” papar laporan IEA, seperti dikutip dari Bloomberg.

Over the last year, has slightly outperformed the JCI (+1.4%);there were two distinct phases, where it underperformed in 2H last year, and recovered in 1H this year. We missed pickingthe recovery. The stock has seen positive revisions (FY18E consensus EPS up 2.4% since end April), removing an underperformance driver. The valuation differential versus its Indian peer, another of our arguments, has also converged. Without near-term catalysts to take the stock lower, we upgrade our rating to Neutral with a June 18 PT of Rp 45,000 based on 40x 12M Fwd PE.
* Valuation differential argument has evaporated: and HUVR in India have deliveredsimilar rates of earnings growth of 6-7%/9-10% over the last three/five years, respectively. They have broadly similar addressable opportunities and business segments (see table inside for details). We have held the view since last year that ’s 10-15% premium to HUVR appeared unjustified. Multiples have now converged, with both stocks at similar 48x 12m fwd multiples.
* 2Q may have exaggerated weakness across staples: We think that underperformance post 2Q results exaggerated concerns on Indonesian consumption.Fewer working days (81 including weekends)versus 87 in 2QFY16 coloured comparisons. We think this made a difference to staples, but mattered less to retailers. With 89 working days in 3Q vs 85 in 3Q last year, we expect payback this quarter. At the margin, the pessimism overshoot risk makes us more constructive on .
* Revision trends remove underperformance catalyst: We believe is expensive. However, our relative value argument no longer holds true. Further, positive revisions remove a catalyst for the stock to underperform. Both these factors, along with our view that 3Q could see payback after a weak 2Q, prompt us to raise to Neutral from UW.

1.Indonesian Economic

Deutsche (DB)
Reiterate neutral market call and stock picking by elimination
Benign present inflation and similar prospect in 2018 (Bank Indonesia: < 3 .5%) have attracted sizeable inflow into government bond (US$9.0bn YtD, +13.8% YoY). The yield curve has steepened with the 10-year yield in particular dropping -127.7bps YtD to four-year low of 6.7% though still above Malaysia’s/Thailand’s/Philippines’s at 2%-5%. At the same time, low inflation also implies sluggish economic growth that washes out equity appetite and thus the outflow of US$4.4mn YtD (2016: US$2.8bn inflow). All in all, we reiterate our neutral market call through end year and the stock picking by elimination on the three criteria of wallet size, wallet share, and flow.

4.Infrastructure

Jakarta - Pemerintah Jepang akan membantu percepatan pembangunan tujuh proyek infrastruktur. Ketujuh proyek ini tersebar mulai dari pembangunan jalan tol hingga eksplorasi minyak. Menteri Pekerjaan Umum dan Perumahan Rakyat (PUPR) Basuki Hadimuljono mengatakan, proyek pertama yang akan dipercepat pengerjaannya adalah pelabuhan Patimbang. Pelabuhan yang berada di kota Subang, Jawa Barat ini ditarget bisa dibuka pada Maret 2019.
"Pemerintah Indonesia dan mereka (pemerintah Jepang) sama-sama mengusulkan agar proyek ini dipercepat," kata Basuki ditemui di Istana Negara, Selasa (5/9). Selain pembangunan pelabuhannya, pengembang juga sedang menyiapkan akses untuk sampai ke jalan nasional yang berujung di Tol Cipali (Patimbang-Cipali) dengan panjang mencapai 40 km. Total biaya kontruski mencapai Rp 3,86 triliun, dan biaya investasi (2017) mencapai Rp 5,35 triliun. Akses ini akan dikonstruksi pada 2018 dan diharap bisa dioperasionalkan pada 2020.

2.Nilai tukar rupiah terhadap dolar Amerika Serikat (AS) bergerak stabil pada perdagangan Rabu ini. Pelaku pasar menunggu data indeks kepercayaan konsumen. Mengutip Bloomberg, Rabu (6/9/2017), rupiah dibuka di angka 13.335 per dolar AS, menguat tipis jika dibandingkan dengan penutupan perdagangan sebelumnya yang ada di angka 13.338 per dolar AS. Sejak pagi hingga siang hari ini, rupiah bergerak di kisaran 13.328 per dolar AS hingga 13.342 per dolar AS. Jika dihitung dari awal tahun, rupiah mampu menguat 1,02 persen. Sedangkan berdasarkan Kurs Referensi Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) Bank Indonesia (BI), rupiah dipatok di angka 13.337 per dolar AS, tak berbeda jauh dengan patokan sehari sebelumnya yang ada di angka 13.336 per dolar AS.
Dolar AS memang tertekan di Asia sejak awal pekan. Pelemahan dolar AS terutama terhadap yen Jepang yang merupakan salah satu instrumen safe haven. Penyebab investor menumpuk instrumen penyelamat karena adanya konflik di Semenanjung Korea.
Pelemahan dolar AS semakin dalam usai pejabat Bank Sentral AS Lael Brainard mengatakan bahwa inflasi masih berada di bawah target sehingga rencana kenaikan suku bunga agak terganggu. Perhatian investor tampaknya akan tertuju pada rilis indeks keyakinan konsumen Indonesia pada hari Kamis yang akan memberi gambaran lebih jauh tentang perekonomian negara ini. Peningkatan keyakinan konsumen dapat semakin memperkuat IHSG dan rupiah.


3.Coal
European Coal Jumps to 4-Year High as Commodities Extend Advance
(Bloomberg) -- European coal for 2018 jumped to its highest in almost four years as China hinted at curbing capacity and southern European demand for power generation increased.
Other commodities are also surging, with steel rebar in China posting its highest close since February 2013 and copper rising to a three-year high.
Coal jumped 1.4 percent to $80 a ton Tuesday, the highest traded price since October 2013 on London’s ICE Futures Europe exchange. German power is up 10 percent this year, while European Union carbon allowances have surged by more than 40 percent since April.
Italy’s use of conventional thermal power was up 4.5 percent in July versus the same month last year, while hydropower generation was down 15 percent, according to data from Terna SpA. Spain’s water reserves are more than 25 percent below the 10-year average.

Unilever Indonesia, Tbk. ($UNVR):
Awaiting and Observing Potent Consumers in Indonesia
NH Korindo Sekuritas Indonesia Company Report


Competitive Price Dominance
UNVR booked the 2Q17 anemic performance evidenced by decrease of 3.2% in sales from IDR10.7 trillion in 2Q16 into IDR10.4 trillion in 2Q17. Such downward sales caused UNVR to book decrease of 3.8% in net profit from IDR1.72 trillion in 2Q16 into IDR1.66 trillion in 2Q17.

Although suffered from sales figure, it remained booking stable gross profit margin in its two business divisions, namely home and personal care (HPC) and food and refreshment (FR). The stable gross profit margin booked by these two division indicated that dominates competitive price in Indonesia’s market.

Relying on Potent Consumers in Indonesia
Expectancy of recovery in Indonesia’s economic growth of 2018 is catalyst for rally in purchasing power of Indonesia’s consumers. This backdrop will inevitably spurs rally in ’s growth.

Another positive aspect spurring ’s rally was a large number of Indonesia’s young population having better prosperity. In addition, the low consumption level of products will widen the long term growth for .

Target Price of Rp58,750
We use an estimate of forward P/E of 54.6x (2SD higher than the 3 years average at 47.0x) as basis of valuation method for obtaining target price. This target price implies a 2018/E P/E of 58.2X. Now, is traded at a 2017E P/E of 54.3x)

* Valuation differential argument has evaporated: and HUVR in India have deliveredsimilar rates of earnings growth of 6-7%/9-10% over the last three/five years, respectively. They have broadly similar addressable opportunities and business segments (see table inside for details). We have held the view since last year that ’s 10-15% premium to HUVR appeared unjustified. Multiples have now converged, with both stocks at similar 48x 12m fwd multiples.
* 2Q may have exaggerated weakness across staples: We think that underperformance post 2Q results exaggerated concerns on Indonesian consumption.Fewer working days (81 including weekends)versus 87 in 2QFY16 coloured comparisons. We think this made a difference to staples, but mattered less to retailers. With 89 working days in 3Q vs 85 in 3Q last year, we expect payback this quarter. At the margin, the pessimism overshoot risk makes us more constructive on .
* Revision trends remove underperformance catalyst: We believe is expensive. However, our relative value argument no longer holds true. Further, positive revisions remove a catalyst for the stock to underperform. Both these factors, along with our view that 3Q could see payback after a weak 2Q, prompt us to raise to Neutral from UW.

Nomura Favors Indonesian Consumer Stocks on Spending Recovery
By Harry Suhartono

(Bloomberg) -- After a period of underperformance, Indonesia’s consumer stocks may benefit from a revival in the disposable incomes of low-income households in 2018, according to Nomura Holdings.
* Government’s plan to expand coverage under conditional cash transfer plan may support recovery in consumption, Nomura analysts led by Elvira Tjandrawinata, write in report
* Indofood Sukses Makmur, Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna, Mitra Adiperkasa, Ace Hardware Indonesia and Surya Citra Media are Nomura’s top stock picks
* Expected acceleration in GDP growth on increased infrastructure spending and private spending also help the recovery
* Consumer companies under Nomura’s coverage may enjoy 10.2% revenue growth and 12.3% earnings growth in 2018
Growth accelerates from expected 8% and 7.3% increase for top line and bottom line in 2017
* Valuation for consumer goods companies excluding Unilever Indonesia has remained range-bound since 2014
* Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna likely to benefit from lower excise tax increase; Indofood Sukses provides alternative to Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur due to more attractive valuations
* NOTE: Aug. 24, Falling Advertising Budget Takes Toll on Indonesian TV Stocks

Sell Indonesian Banks if North Korea Tensions Escalate, UOB Says
By Livia Yap

(Bloomberg) -- UOB sees sharp selloff in global markets and Indonesia if North Korea tensions escalate into a war; sell “expensive” bank names and cement stocks that have outperformed first, analyst Stevanus Juanda writes in a note Thursday.
* Some banks are trading at +2 standard deviation above historical mean PE; sell Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat Dan Banten, Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur and Bank Rakyat Indonesia
* Cement stocks have also outperformed and Semen Indonesia and Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa are now trading above +2 standard deviation above historical mean PE
* After a selloff, Indonesia’s political neutrality could prompt investors to switch from North Asia
Focus on construction plays as govt spending expected to pick up in 2H: Adhi Karya, Pembangunan Perumahan, Waskita Karya
Consumer names as “current weakness in consumer purchasing power is temporary”: Astra International, Ace Hardware, Mitra Adiperkasa, Mayora Indah and Unilever Indonesia
Laggards with potential: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat and Tunas Ridean
* NOTE: Trump Says Talk With North Korea Done as Mattis Urges Diplomacy

$KLBF: A Picture of Good Health
A Picture of Good Health

KLBF’s rosy consumer product outlook should continue to replace the forgone growth opportunity from selective JKN participation, at better margins. In our view, these efforts, alongside the minimized Pharmaceutical risks, are still under-appreciated. Rising interest in the less-penetrated healthcare sector also warrants KLBF a rarity premium for its quality. We believe KLBF deserves more than the 6% YTD discount to JCI index. Re-initiate with a Buy and Rp1,900 price target.

Consumer products' performance has been underappreciated. We believe that the negative sentiment of JKN (universal healthcare) has been more than priced in, despite muted Pharmaceuticals margin decline (60.8% in 2013 vs. 57.7% in 2016) and converging growths of its three sub-segments. Nutritionals and Consumer Health have also booked strong performance (52% of KLBF's sales in 1Q17), beating listed pure-FMCG and dairy peers. KLBF has consistently delivered the highest EBIT margins among FMCG (ex-) and pharmaceutical peers amid weak pricing environment; its FCF yield was also the highest among peers (ex-). For its FMCG potentials, we believe that KLBF deserves re-rating alongside peers’ over-performance, while its quality healthcare nature should warrant a rarity premium amid increasing interest in the underpenetrated sector.

Volume and margin upsides for Nutritionals. Price gap between KLBF’s Morinaga products and main competitor, Bebelac, has started to close, according to our price check, after >15% premium in 2016. This should help KLBF recover its lost share in children’s milk and emphasize its strength as the most affordable premium powdered milk. While price adjustment is unlikely, Nutritionals' margin would enjoy the lower skimmed milk powder price (-12% YTD), against management estimate of 10-20% YoY increase. With 3-6 months' inventory days of milk, margin should improve in 2H17. We expect 100bps gross margin expansion for Nutritionals (58.6% in FY17F), coupled with 12% YoY sales growth, reaching its all-time highest contribution of 30% of KLBF's 2017F sales.

JKN risks are minimized, leaving only crude oil, FX. Growths of Pharmaceutical’s three sub-segments have converged over-time (Figure 18). Should these trends be maintained, we believe KLBF could buy time and maintain volume growth before specialty drugs come into play. However, risks remain on crude oil price, whose correlation to Pharmaceuticals' gross margin dropped after JKN, implying the severity of generic’s pricing. Another risk is FX movement; although, we deem KLBF’s internal rate is too conservative at Rp14,000/USD. Should IDR land flat (5% discrepancy to guidance), there could be c.260/150bps upside to KLBF’s/our EBIT margin estimates.

Re-initiate with a Buy. For minimized risks and growth recovery (12%/11% 2017F/18F EPS growth), we believe the stock deserves re-rating above its 5-year mean. We re-initiate with a Buy call and Rp1,900 TP, implying 32.6x average 2017-2018 forward P/E

News Highlight

* PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure Tbk ($TBIG) mencicipi berkah dari teknologi 4G. Hal ini terlihat dari permintaan menara yang terus naik. Memanfaatkan peluang, TBIG makin ekspansif dengan menambah jumlah menara telekomunikasi. Menurut manajemen TBIG, ekspansi perusahaan yang saat ini dilakukan berjalan beriringan dengan ekspansi para operator telekomunikasi. Ini karena operator diharuskan memasang antena 4G di menara. Operator telekomunikasi rajin menambah kekuatan sinyal da jangkauan. Perseroan mengatakan, sepanjang tahun ini, ekspansi menara TBIG sudah lebih dari 50% target di akhir tahun. TBIG akan lebih ekspansif pada semester dua ini.

* PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk () melihat potensi pasar es krim di Indonesia masih sangat besar. Produsen es krim Walls ini berniat memperbesar bisnis es krimnya di tahun ini. Walls terus meluncurkan varian dan produk baru es krim demi mempertahankan posisi sebagai pemain utama di pasar tersebut. Tahun ini tercatat, Walls memperkenalkan brand baru “Solero” untuk es krimnya. Selain itu, sebagai katergori yang mengandalkan dorongan impulsif dari konsumen, meraih banyak manfaat dari kampanye TB dan digital. Sejauh ini di kuartal pertama 2017, penjualan segmen makanan dan minuman tumbuh 12,9% dari 3,1 triliun menjadi 3,5 triliun. Sementara kontribusi makanan dan minuman sekitar 32% dari total pendapatan.

* PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk () mencatatkan kenaikan volume produksi minyak dan gas sebesar 41,7% sepanjang kuartal I 2017dibandingkan kuartal I 2016. Manajemen mengungkapkan peningkatan voume produksi tersebut disebabkan tingginya penjualan gas dari lapangan Senoro dan kontribusi penuh dari lapangan Blok B Laut Natuna Selatan yang diakuisisi sebanyak 40% pada kuartal IV 2016. Roberto Lorato, CEO MEDC mengatakan saat ini dapat melihat dampak akuisisi tahun lalu secara menyeluruh dan upaya manajemen untuk meningkatkan produksi dengan tetap mempertahankan biaya-biaya operasi.

Defisit keseimbangan primer pada semetster I 2017 sebesar Rp 68,2 triliun turun dibanding semester I 2016 sebesar Rp 143,4 triliun. PT. Valbury Sekuritas Indonesia

Rabu, 21 Juni 2017

VIEW MARKET 
Sentimen pasar dari luar negeri:
• Pasar akan menyikapi pidato anggota FOMC Robert Kaplan pada hari Rabu waktu setempat. Selain dari komentar pejabat the Fed, data yang juga di nantikan adalah Existing Home Sales bulan Mei 2017 dan data persediaan minyak untuk industri di AS per 16 Juni 2017. Sebelumnya data Existing Home Sales bulan April  turun 11,4% menjadi 569.000 unit. Dan persedian minyak AS dalam sepekan sebelumnya yang berakhir Jumat (9/6/2017) turun 1,66 juta barel menjadi 511,55 juta barel.
• Sentimen lainnya pasar akan menyikapi, pidato ratu Elizabeth II mengenai hasil pemilu dan proses negosiasi Brexit. Sementara itu, pasar khawatirkan negosiasi Brexit bisa tertunda.
Sentimen pasar dari dalam negeri :
• Dari dalam negeri yang dapat memicu ketidakpastian bagi pasar terkait dengan pernyataan dari Gubernur Bank Indonesia (BI) Agus Martowardojo mengatakan bahwa ada indikasi pertumbuhan ekonomi pada kuartal II ini tidak sesuai harapan. Padahal, sebelumnya BI memprediksi ekonomi kuartal II lebih baik daripada kuartal I lalu dan tumbuh sebesar 5,11 persen.
• Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Darmin Nasution menyebutkan, angka inflasi bulanan ditarget bertahan di level 0,39 hingga 0,4 persen. Optimisme pemerintah atas tingkat inflasi yang rendah seiring harga bahan pangan terutama bawang putih dan cabai rawit yang mengalami penurunan sejak awal Juni 2017
Prediksi IHSG :
• Faktor eksternal diatas dapat berpengaruh bagi bursa global, termasuk dampaknya bagi IHSG. Namun. jelang libur panjang lebaran dan kenaikan IHSG beruntun dalam dua hari terakhir serta potensi melemah pasar Asia, maka rawan terkoreksi bagi IHSG pada hari ini.

Market Summary
PT. Valbury Sekuritas Indonesia

Jumat, 16 Juni 2017

VIEW MARKET 
Sentimen pasar dari luar negeri:
• Presiden AS Donald Trump sedang diselidiki oleh pengacara khusus Robert Mueller atas kemungkinan menghalang-halangi penegakan hukum. Mueller memimpin penyelidikan yang dilakukan FBI atas tuduhan bahwa Rusia mencampuri pemilihan umum AS 2016, serta setiap keterkaitannya dengan Trump. Di pihak lain, Trump berulang kali menyangkal adanya kolusi dengan Rusia.
Sentimen pasar dari dalam negeri :
• Bank Indonesia (BI) optimistis pertumbuhan ekonomi pada triwulan II 2017 membaik didukung oleh tumbuhnya ekspor, meningkatnya investasi, dan tetap kuatnya konsumsi.  BI menilai ekspor tumbuh cukup baik sejalan dengan berlanjutnya perbaikan ekonomi global dan kenaikan harga beberapa komoditas global.
• Selain itu, BI juga perkirakan Neraca Pembayaran Indonesia (NPI) pada triwulan II 2017 tetap mencatat surplus, ditopang oleh surplus transaksi modal dan finansial. Sementara itu, defisit transaksi berjalan diperkirakan tetap terjaga pada level yang sehat.
• Katalis positif lainnya dari dalam negeri, Pemerintah meluncurkan paket kebijakan ekonomi tahap XV untuk mengembangkan usaha dan daya saing penyedia jasa logistik nasional.
Prediksi IHSG :
• Akumulasi katalis positif dari dalam negeri, ditambah perkiraan pasar Asia menguat dapat memberikan dukungan bagi IHSG untuk melaju keteritorial positif pada perdagangan saham hari ini

• Moodys Service menaikkan prospek industri perbankan Indonesia dari stabil ke positif akan menambah keyakinan pelaku industri dan investor bahwa kinerja perbankan 2017 akan jauh lebih baik dibanding 2016

Market Summary
PT. Valbury Sekuritas Indonesia


Senin, 05 Juni 2017

VIEW MARKET 
Sentimen pasar dari luar negeri:
• Ditengah kekhawatiran kebijakan dari Presiden Amerika Serikat (AS) Donald Trump yang dianggap bisa membahayakan perencanaan ekonomi, termasuk soal pajak dan infrastruktur, namun ekonomi AS menciptakan 66.000 pekerjaan lebih sedikit dari yang dilaporkan pada Maret dan April. Tingkat pengangguran di AS pada Mei 2017 sampai ke titik terendah sepanjang 16 tahun terakhir, yaitu 4,3%. Hal ini akan mempengaruhi keputusan Bank Sentral AS, Federal Reserve untuk menaikkan suku bunga pada 13-14 Juni mendatang.
• Trump akhirnya putuskan AS keluar dari kesepakatan Paris Climate demi pekerja AS. Trump menegaskan Paris Accord melemahkan ekonomi dan kedaulatan AS.
Sentimen pasar dari dalam negeri :
• Kenaikan harga jelang memasuki bulan Ramadhan ditunjukkan oleh naiknya seluruh indeks kelompok pengeluaran mengakibatkan kenaikan inflasi Mei sebesar  0,39 persen. Angka ini naik dari inflasi April 2017 sebesar 0,09 persen. Diharapkan tingkat inflasi periode Ramadan dan Lebaran pada Juni 2017 dapat lebih terkendali, meski harga komoditas pangan diperkirakan naik.
• Keberhasilan Indonesia mendapatkan peringkat layak investasi dari tiga lembaga rating terkemuka diharapkan dapat memicu lebih banyak aliran dana asing masuk ke Indonesia. Bank Indonesia (BI) perkirakan dengan perolehan peringkat ini dapat mendorong masuknya aliran modal asing (foreign direct investment/FDI) hingga 1,5 tahun ke depan.
Prediksi IHSG :
• Data ekonomi AS yang positif, namun bersamaan dengan kebijakan Trump yang memutuskan keluar dari kesepakatan Paris Climate, dapat menjadi katalis negatif bagi pasar. Sementara itu dari dalam negeri perkiraan masih tingginya inflasi Juni dapat berimflikasi negatif bagi IHSG di tengah minimnya insentif positif ke pasar dalam pekan ini.
